public_information: Schedule a 30 minute meeting during work hours from 9:00 to 17:00 on Monday
All participants must attend the same 30 minute slot
Time is represented in 30 minute granularity
There exists a solution that fits all participants' schedules

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL problems targeting the FastDownwards PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the scheduling task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is Emily. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->Emily->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->Emily->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards PDDL solver. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownwards PDDL solver. You always provide a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the scheduling task. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: There are multiple agents participating in scheduling. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to schedule a 30 minute meeting during work hours on Monday 9:00-17:00 with all participants. Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or ambiguous. You need to integrate their PDDL responses, reconcile naming differences, and ensure actions remain distinct per agent. Here is the information the agents provided: {pddl_Emily} {pddl_Brian} {pddl_Gerald} {pddl_Julia} {pddl_Logan} {pddl_Judith} {pddl_Michael} Think step by step and provide a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards PDDL solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
